dependencies.description: Programmatic API for npm fund
Manage node_modules trees
Compare strings with Intl.Collator if available, falling back to String.localeCompare otherwise
filesystem utilities for the npm cli
Get the list of files installed in a package in node_modules, including bundled dependencies
Retrieves a name:pathname Map for a given workspaces config
Calculate meta-vulnerabilities from package security advisories
Get the package name from a folder path
Tools for dealing with node-gyp packages
Programmatic API to update package.json
npm query parser and tools
Redact sensitive npm information from output
Run a lifecycle script for a package (descendant of npm-lifecycle)
JavaScript package binary linker
Fast, fault-tolerant, cross-platform, disk-based, data-agnostic, content-addressable cache.
Find the common ancestor of 2 or more paths on Windows or Unix
Provides metadata and conversions from repository urls for GitHub, Bitbucket and GitLab
JSON.parse with context information on error
Stringify an object sorting scalars before objects, and defaulting to 2-space indent
A cache object that deletes the least-recently-used items.
a glob matcher in javascript
Option parsing for Node, supporting types, shorthands, etc. Used by npm.
Check the engines and platform fields in package.json
Parse the things that can be arguments to `npm install`
Resolves a matching manifest from a package metadata document according to standard npm semver resolution rules.
Fetch-based http client for use with npm registry APIs
JavaScript package downloader
Parse a JSON string that has git merge conflicts, resolving if possible
just emit 'log' events on the process object
Progress bar updates at a distance
Like Promise.all, but save rejections until all promises are resolved
Call an array of promise-returning functions, restricting concurrency to a specified limit.
Like read-package-json, but faster
The semantic version parser used by npm.
Standard Subresource Integrity library -- parses, serializes, generates, and verifies integrity metadata according to the SRI spec.
Walk any kind of tree structure depth- or breadth-first. Supports promises and advanced map-reduce operations with a very small API.
Given a path string, return a generator that walks up the path, emitting each dirname.
a util for spawning git from npm CLI contexts
spawn processes the way the npm cli likes to do
Like ruby's abbrev module, but in js
Brace expansion as known from sh/bash
Used in npm for command line application support
fs read and write streams based on minipass
the most correct and second fastest glob implementation in JavaScript
This is a pure-js JSON streaming parser for node.js
Return an object representing the diffs between two objects. Supports jsonPatch protocol
Apply a diff to an object. Optionally supports jsonPatch protocol
Opinionated, caching, retrying fetch client
minimal implementation of a PassThrough stream
A Minipass stream that collects all the data into a single chunk
An implementation of window.fetch in Node.js using Minipass streams
A Minipass stream that calls a flush function before emitting 'end'
create a pipeline of streams using Minipass
A small fast zlib stream built on [minipass](http://npm.im/minipass) and Node.js's zlib binding.
Node.js native addon build tool
Normalizes data that can be found in package.json files.
list things in node_modules that are bundledDependencies, or transitive dependencies thereof
Turn any flavor of allowable package.json bin into a normalized object
Get a list of the files to add from a folder into an npm package
Map over promises concurrently
> Selector parser with built in methods for working with selector strings.
Retries a function that returns a promise, leveraging the power of the retry module.
Figure out what a cmd-shim is pointing at. This acts as the equivalent of fs.readlink.
code-signing for npm packages
tar for node
Generate a unique filename for use in temporary directories or caches.
Give me a string and I'll tell you if it's a valid npm package name
Like which(1) unix command. Find the first instance of an executable in the PATH.
Write files in an atomic fashion w/configurable ownership
the http/https agent used by the npm cli
Sigstore bundle type
Base library for Sigstore

Sigstore signing library
Client for the Sigstore TUF repository
Verification of Sigstore signatures
Create an error from multiple errors
Match balanced character pairs, like "{" and "}"
like `chown -R`
A JavaScript library for escaping CSS strings and identifiers while generating the shortest possible ASCII-only output.
Convert encodings, uses iconv-lite
Get paths for storing things like data, config, cache, etc
Create an error with a code
A utility that allows retrying a function with an exponential delay between attempts.
Run a child as if it's the foreground process. Give it stdio. Exit when it exits.
fs read and write streams based on minipass
A drop-in replacement for fs, making various improvements.
Parses Cache-Control and other headers. Helps building correct HTTP caches and proxies
Nested/recursive `.gitignore`/`.npmignore` parsing and filtering.
An incremental implementation of MurmurHash3
An ini encoder/decoder for node
Detect if your code is running on an AWS Lambda server
Minimal module to check if a file is executable.
A very strict and proper argument parser.
minimal implementation of a PassThrough stream
minimal implementation of a PassThrough stream
A Minipass stream that raises an error if you get a different number of bytes than expected
Recursively mkdir, like `mkdir -p`
HTTP content negotiation
Load the local package.json from either src or dist folder
walk paths fast and efficiently
One promise for multiple requests in flight to avoid async duplication
Abstraction for exponential and custom retry strategies for failed operations.
when you want to fire an event no matter how a process exits.
Generate a unique character string suitible for use in files and URLs.
The Node.js `util.deprecate()` function with browser support
Give me a string and I'll tell you if it's a valid npm package license string
Yet Another Linked List
easily create complex multi-column command-line-interfaces
Polyfill of future proposal for `util.parseArgs()`
Turn a function into an `http.Agent` instance
Clean up error stack traces
Cross platform child_process#spawn and child_process#spawnSync
An HTTP(s) proxy `http.Agent` implementation for HTTP
An HTTP(s) proxy `http.Agent` implementation for HTTPS
Convert character encodings in pure javascript.
Indent each line in a string
A SOCKS proxy `http.Agent` implementation for HTTP and HTTPS
correct invalid SPDX expressions
parse SPDX license expressions
JavaScript implementation of The Update Framework (TUF)
TUF metadata models
Lightweight debugging utility for Node.js and the browser
Get the PATH environment variable key cross-platform
Modern Buffer API polyfill without footguns
Get the command from a shebang

list of SPDX standard license exceptions
A list of SPDX license identifiers

Get the visual width of a string - the number of columns required to display it
Strip ANSI escape codes from a string
Strip ANSI escape codes from a string
Like which(1) unix command. Find the first instance of an executable in the PATH.
Wordwrap a string with ANSI escape codes
Wordwrap a string with ANSI escape codes
OLPC JSON canonicalization
Regular expression for matching ANSI escape codes
Regular expression for matching ANSI escape codes
ANSI escape codes for styling strings in the terminal
ANSI escape codes for styling strings in the terminal
Get East Asian Width from a character.

A regular expression to match all Emoji-only symbols as per the Unicode Standard.
A library for parsing IPv4 and IPv6 IP addresses in node and the browser.
Check if the character represented by a given Unicode code point is fullwidth
Minimal module to check if a file is executable.
Tiny millisecond conversion utility
Regular expression for matching a shebang line
smart-buffer is a Buffer wrapper that adds automatic read & write offset tracking, string operations, data insertions, and more.
Plain color conversion functions
The jsbn library is a fast, portable implementation of large-number math in pure JavaScript, enabling public-key crypto and other applications on desktop and mobile browsers.
JavaScript sprintf implementation
A list of color names and its values
